examples.sql: SELECT COUNT(*) as TotalClients FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0

SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT c.ID) as ActiveClients FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND o.Created >= DATEADD(year, -1, GETDATE())
SELECT TOP 20 ID, Name, Phone, Email FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Name LIKE '%keyword%' ORDER BY Name

SELECT TOP 10 c.ID, c.Name, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalPurchases FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON o.ID = oi.OrderID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name ORDER BY TotalPurchases DESC

SELECT TOP 10 c.ID, c.Name, COUNT(o.ID) as OrderCount FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name ORDER BY OrderCount DESC
SELECT TOP 20 ID, Name, Phone, Email, Created FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 ORDER BY Created DESC
SELECT TOP 50 ID, Name, Phone, Address FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND (Address LIKE '%Київ%' OR Address LIKE '%Kyiv%' OR City LIKE '%Київ%')
SELECT Region, COUNT(*) as ClientCount FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Region IS NOT NULL GROUP BY Region ORDER BY ClientCount DESC

SELECT TOP 50 c.ID, c.Name, c.Phone, c.Created FROM dbo.Client c LEFT JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID AND o.Deleted = 0 WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.ID IS NULL ORDER BY c.Created DESC
SELECT TOP 100 ID, Name, Email, Phone FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Email IS NOT NULL AND Email != '' ORDER BY Name
SELECT TOP 100 ID, Name, Phone, Email FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Phone IS NOT NULL AND Phone != '' ORDER BY Name
SELECT ID, Name, Phone, Email, Created FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND CAST(Created AS DATE) = CAST(GETDATE() AS DATE) ORDER BY Created DESC
SELECT COUNT(*) as NewClientsThisMonth FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND MONTH(Created) = MONTH(GETDATE()) AND YEAR(Created) = YEAR(GETDATE())
SELECT COUNT(*) as NewClientsThisYear FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND YEAR(Created) = YEAR(GETDATE())

SELECT YEAR(Created) as Year, MONTH(Created) as Month, COUNT(*) as NewClients FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Created >= DATEADD(year, -1, GETDATE()) GROUP BY YEAR(Created), MONTH(Created) ORDER BY Year, Month

SELECT AVG(ClientTotal) as AvgOrderValuePerClient FROM (SELECT c.ID, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as ClientTotal FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON o.ID = oi.OrderID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID) as ClientTotals

SELECT TOP 20 o.ID, o.Created, COUNT(oi.ID) as ItemCount, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as OrderTotal FROM dbo.[Order] o JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON o.ID = oi.OrderID WHERE o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND o.ClientID = @ClientID GROUP BY o.ID, o.Created ORDER BY o.Created DESC

SELECT TOP 50 c.ID, c.Name, MAX(o.Created) as LastOrderDate FROM dbo.Client c LEFT JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID AND o.Deleted = 0 WHERE c.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name ORDER BY LastOrderDate DESC

SELECT TOP 50 c.ID, c.Name, MAX(o.Created) as LastOrderDate FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name HAVING MAX(o.Created) < DATEADD(month, -6, GETDATE()) ORDER BY LastOrderDate DESC

examples.question_uk: VIP клієнти за загальною сумою витрат
examples.sql: SELECT TOP 20 c.ID, c.Name, c.Phone, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalSpent, COUNT(DISTINCT o.ID) as OrderCount FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON o.ID = oi.OrderID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name, c.Phone ORDER BY TotalSpent DESC
SELECT Source, COUNT(*) as ClientCount FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Source IS NOT NULL GROUP BY Source ORDER BY ClientCount DESC

SELECT TOP 50 ca.ID, c.Name as ClientName, ca.AgreementNumber, ca.Created, ca.ValidUntil FROM dbo.ClientAgreement ca JOIN dbo.Client c ON ca.ClientID = c.ID WHERE ca.Deleted = 0 AND c.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY ca.Created DESC
SELECT Phone, COUNT(*) as DuplicateCount FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Phone IS NOT NULL AND Phone != '' GROUP BY Phone HAVING COUNT(*) > 1 ORDER BY DuplicateCount DESC

examples.question_en: Total amount spent by all clients
examples.sql: SELECT SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalClientSpending FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON o.ID = oi.OrderID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0
SELECT ID, Name, Phone, Email, Address FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND Phone LIKE '%keyword%'
SELECT TOP 50 ID, Name, Phone, Email, EDRPOU FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND EDRPOU IS NOT NULL AND EDRPOU != '' ORDER BY Name
SELECT TOP 50 ID, Name, Phone, Email FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 AND (EDRPOU IS NULL OR EDRPOU = '') ORDER BY Name

SELECT TOP 50 c.ID, c.Name, c.Phone, SUM(d.Amount) as TotalDebt FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.Debt d ON c.ID = d.ClientID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND d.Deleted = 0 AND d.IsPaid = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name, c.Phone HAVING SUM(d.Amount) > 0 ORDER BY TotalDebt DESC

SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN OrderCount > 1 THEN ClientID END) * 100.0 / COUNT(DISTINCT ClientID) as RetentionRate FROM (SELECT o.ClientID, COUNT(*) as OrderCount FROM dbo.[Order] o WHERE o.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY o.ClientID) as ClientOrders
SELECT TOP 100 ID, Name, Phone, Email, Address, Created FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0 ORDER BY Name
SELECT TOP 20 c.ID, c.Name, c.LegalAddress, c.MobileNumber FROM dbo.Client c WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND (c.LegalAddress LIKE N'%Хмельниц%' OR c.ActualAddress LIKE N'%Хмельниц%') ORDER BY c.Name

examples.question_en: Top clients by number of orders
examples.sql: SELECT TOP 10 c.Name, COUNT(DISTINCT o.ID) as OrderCount FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name ORDER BY OrderCount DESC

SELECT DISTINCT p.Name, p.VendorCode, SUM(oi.Qty) as TotalQty FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID JOIN dbo.Product p ON p.ID = oi.ProductID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND c.Name LIKE N'%keyword%' GROUP BY p.ID, p.Name, p.VendorCode ORDER BY TotalQty DESC

SELECT c.Name, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalAmount FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND c.Name LIKE N'%keyword%' GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name

SELECT TOP 30 c.ID, c.Name, c.LegalAddress FROM dbo.Client c WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND (c.LegalAddress LIKE N'%keyword%' OR c.ActualAddress LIKE N'%keyword%' OR c.DeliveryAddress LIKE N'%keyword%') ORDER BY c.Name

SELECT o.ID, o.Created, c.Name as ClientName FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND ca.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY o.Created DESC
examples.critical_note: NEVER use Order.ClientID - it does not exist! Use ClientAgreement as bridge.

examples.sql: SELECT c.Name, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalAmount FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name

SELECT TOP 50 o.ID, o.Created, c.Name as ClientName, c.Phone FROM dbo.[Order] o JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.Client c ON ca.ClientID = c.ID WHERE o.Deleted = 0 AND c.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY o.Created DESC
examples.critical_note: From Order: first join ClientAgreement, then join Client

examples.sql: SELECT c.ID, c.Name, COUNT(o.ID) as OrderCount FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY c.ID, c.Name ORDER BY OrderCount DESC
examples.critical_note: Client -> ClientAgreement -> Order for counting orders

examples.sql: SELECT TOP 10 o.ID, o.Created, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as OrderTotal FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND c.Name LIKE N'%keyword%' GROUP BY o.ID, o.Created ORDER BY o.Created DESC
examples.critical_note: Always use ClientAgreement between Client and Order

examples.sql: SELECT p.Name as ProductName, p.VendorCode, SUM(oi.Qty) as TotalQty FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID JOIN dbo.Product p ON oi.ProductID = p.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND p.Deleted = 0 AND c.Name LIKE N'%keyword%' GROUP BY p.ID, p.Name, p.VendorCode ORDER BY TotalQty DESC
examples.critical_note: Full path: Client -> ClientAgreement -> Order -> OrderItem -> Product

examples.sql: SELECT DISTINCT c.ID, c.Name FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID JOIN dbo.Product p ON oi.ProductID = p.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND p.Deleted = 0 AND p.VendorCode LIKE N'SEM%' ORDER BY c.Name
examples.critical_note: Brand filter: p.VendorCode LIKE N'SEM%'. Path: Client -> ClientAgreement -> Order -> OrderItem -> Product

examples.sql: SELECT DISTINCT c.ID, c.Name FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND MONTH(o.Created) = 10 AND YEAR(o.Created) = 2024 ORDER BY c.Name
examples.critical_note: Date filter on Order.Created. Path: Client -> ClientAgreement -> Order

examples.question_en: Clients who bought SEM products in October 2024
examples.question_uk: Клієнти які купували товари SEM в жовтні 2024 року
variations_en: customers who bought SEM in October
examples.sql: SELECT DISTINCT c.ID, c.Name FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID JOIN dbo.Product p ON oi.ProductID = p.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND p.Deleted = 0 AND p.VendorCode LIKE N'SEM%' AND MONTH(o.Created) = 10 AND YEAR(o.Created) = 2024 ORDER BY c.Name
examples.critical_note: Combined brand and date filter. Path: Client -> ClientAgreement -> Order -> OrderItem -> Product

examples.sql: SELECT DISTINCT c.ID, c.Name FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID JOIN dbo.Product p ON oi.ProductID = p.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND p.Deleted = 0 AND p.VendorCode LIKE N'MG%' ORDER BY c.Name
SELECT TOP 20 c.ID, c.Name, r.Name as RegionCode FROM dbo.Client c INNER JOIN dbo.Region r ON c.RegionID = r.ID WHERE r.Name = 'KI' AND c.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY c.Name
examples.notes: Region codes: KI=Kyiv, XM=Khmelnytskyi, LV=Lviv, OD=Odesa, DN=Donetsk, DP=Dnipro

examples.sql: SELECT TOP 20 c.ID, c.Name, r.Name as RegionCode FROM dbo.Client c INNER JOIN dbo.Region r ON c.RegionID = r.ID WHERE r.Name = 'LV' AND c.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY c.Name
SELECT TOP 20 c.ID, c.Name, r.Name as RegionCode FROM dbo.Client c INNER JOIN dbo.Region r ON c.RegionID = r.ID WHERE r.Name = 'XV' AND c.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY c.Name
SELECT TOP 20 c.ID, c.Name, r.Name as RegionCode FROM dbo.Client c INNER JOIN dbo.Region r ON c.RegionID = r.ID WHERE r.Name = 'OD' AND c.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY c.Name
SELECT r.Name as RegionCode, COUNT(c.ID) as ClientCount FROM dbo.Client c INNER JOIN dbo.Region r ON c.RegionID = r.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY r.Name ORDER BY ClientCount DESC

examples.question_en: Clients from specific region by code
examples.sql: SELECT TOP 30 c.ID, c.Name, c.LegalAddress, r.Name as RegionCode FROM dbo.Client c INNER JOIN dbo.Region r ON c.RegionID = r.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND r.Name = 'XX' ORDER BY c.Name
examples.notes: Replace XX with region code: KI=Kyiv, LV=Lviv, OD=Odesa, DN=Donetsk, DP=Dnipro, XV=Kharkiv, XM=Khmelnytskyi

examples.sql: SELECT r.ID, r.Name as RegionCode FROM dbo.Region r WHERE r.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY r.Name

examples.question_en: Products purchased by client with date
examples.question_uk: Товари які купував клієнт з датою покупки
variations_en: what did client buy and when
products bought by customer with purchase date
variations_uk: список товарів які купував клієнт з датою покупки
examples.sql: SELECT p.Name as ProductName, p.VendorCode, oi.Qty as Quantity, o.Created as OrderDate FROM dbo.Product p JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON p.ID = oi.ProductID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON oi.OrderID = o.ID JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.Client c ON ca.ClientID = c.ID WHERE c.Name LIKE N'%ClientName%' AND p.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND c.Deleted = 0 ORDER BY o.Created DESC
examples.notes: Replace ClientName with actual client name. Order.Created is the purchase date.

examples.question_en: Compare FOP vs TOV client counts
examples.question_uk: Порівняти кількість ФОП та ТОВ клієнтів
variations_en: how many FOP vs TOV clients
count clients by type FOP TOV
variations_uk: яких клієнтів більше ФОП чи ТОВ
examples.sql: SELECT SUM(CASE WHEN Name LIKE N'%ФОП%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as FOP_Count, SUM(CASE WHEN Name LIKE N'%ТОВ' OR Name LIKE N'ТОВ %' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as TOV_Count, SUM(CASE WHEN Name LIKE N'%ПП' OR Name LIKE N'ПП %' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as PP_Count FROM dbo.Client WHERE Deleted = 0
examples.notes: Client type determined by name pattern: ФОП (sole proprietor), ТОВ (LLC), ПП (private enterprise)

examples.question_en: Who buys more - FOP or TOV clients
examples.question_uk: Хто більше купляє ФОП чи ТОВ
variations_uk: хто більше купляє фоп чи тов
examples.sql: SELECT CASE WHEN c.Name LIKE N'%ФОП%' THEN 'ФОП' WHEN c.Name LIKE N'%ТОВ%' THEN 'ТОВ' ELSE 'Інші' END as ClientType, COUNT(DISTINCT c.ID) as ClientCount, COUNT(DISTINCT o.ID) as OrderCount, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalAmount FROM dbo.Client c JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 AND (c.Name LIKE N'%ФОП%' OR c.Name LIKE N'%ТОВ%') GROUP BY CASE WHEN c.Name LIKE N'%ФОП%' THEN 'ФОП' WHEN c.Name LIKE N'%ТОВ%' THEN 'ТОВ' ELSE 'Інші' END ORDER BY TotalAmount DESC
examples.notes: Groups clients by type (ФОП/ТОВ) and compares total purchase amounts

examples.sql: SELECT ID, Name, City, MfoCode FROM dbo.Bank WHERE Deleted = 0 ORDER BY Name
SELECT COUNT(*) as BankCount FROM dbo.Bank WHERE Deleted = 0

examples.question_en: How much did Kyiv region buy in September
variations_en: total sales to Kyiv in September
how much was bought by Kyiv region
examples.sql: SELECT r.Name as RegionCode, COUNT(DISTINCT o.ID) as OrderCount, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalAmount FROM dbo.Region r JOIN dbo.Client c ON c.RegionID = r.ID JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID WHERE r.Name = 'KI' AND DATEPART(MONTH, o.Created) = 9 AND c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY r.Name
examples.notes: CRITICAL: Region.Name contains 2-letter codes, NOT full names. Map: Київ=KI, Львів=LV, Одеса=OD, Харків=XV, Хмельницький=XM, Дніпро=DP. For 'Київ' use WHERE r.Name = 'KI'

examples.question_en: How much did a region buy in a specific month
examples.sql: SELECT r.Name as RegionCode, COUNT(DISTINCT o.ID) as OrderCount, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalAmount FROM dbo.Region r JOIN dbo.Client c ON c.RegionID = r.ID JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID WHERE r.Name = 'XX' AND DATEPART(MONTH, o.Created) = MM AND c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY r.Name
examples.notes: CRITICAL: Region.Name contains 2-letter codes only. Map Ukrainian names to codes: Київ=KI, Львів=LV, Одеса=OD, Харків=XV, Хмельницький=XM, Дніпро=DP. Replace XX with code and MM with month (1-12).

examples.question_en: Show quantity and amount for a region
examples.question_uk: Хмельницький виведи кількість товару і на яку суму
variations_en: how much product and amount for region
variations_uk: Київ виведи кількість товару і суму
Львів кількість товару і на яку суму
скільки товару купив регіон і на яку суму
покажи кількість і суму по регіону
examples.sql: SELECT r.Name as RegionCode, SUM(oi.Qty) as TotalQty, SUM(oi.Qty * oi.PricePerItem) as TotalAmount FROM dbo.Region r JOIN dbo.Client c ON c.RegionID = r.ID JOIN dbo.ClientAgreement ca ON ca.ClientID = c.ID JOIN dbo.[Order] o ON o.ClientAgreementID = ca.ID JOIN dbo.OrderItem oi ON oi.OrderID = o.ID WHERE r.Name = 'XM' AND c.Deleted = 0 AND o.Deleted = 0 AND oi.Deleted = 0 GROUP BY r.Name
examples.notes: CRITICAL: Region.Name column contains 2-letter codes, NOT full names. Map Ukrainian region names to codes: Київ=KI, Львів=LV, Одеса=OD, Харків=XV, Хмельницький=XM, Дніпро=DP. For 'Хмельницький' use WHERE r.Name = 'XM'

examples.question_en: How many clients in Khmelnytskyi region
variations_en: number of clients in Kyiv region
examples.sql: SELECT COUNT(*) as ClientCount FROM dbo.Client c WHERE c.Deleted = 0 AND c.RegionID IN (SELECT ID FROM dbo.Region WHERE Name = 'XM')
examples.notes: CRITICAL: Region.Name contains 2-letter codes only. Map: Київ=KI, Львів=LV, Одеса=OD, Харків=XV, Хмельницький=XM, Дніпро=DP. For 'хмельницькому' use WHERE r.Name = 'XM'
